member.summary: Gets the definition of the "Service" block, which defines both contract and implementation attributes for services managed by the ServiceLocator.
member.remarks: The "Service" block simply declares the contract and implmentation particulars for each of the basic services by indicating the fully-qualified namespaces and class names of each. The ServiceLocator uses these systemically to invoke the logic of individual services on a demand basis, thus efficiently managing the process of loading elements when and where they're needed.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Commerce.Common.TraceLayer
member.summary: Intended to indicate the application layer at which the current Logger.LogTrace./> operation is occurring.

item.description: The presentation layer represents the user interface or target Channel> Presentation Channel for the current application instance.

A "thin" layer used to determine the service to use in processing an individaul request object. (For example; the two main services employed by the application are the ConfigurationService and the OperationService.

list.description: Providers are discrete units of loosely-coupled logic responsible for very specific operations within the application, typically accessed either in-process or via the Windows Communication Foundation (WCF).

remarks.para: This list is not comprehensive; but the type selected should accurately reflect the layer wherein the traced operation occurs.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Commerce.Common.Logger
member.summary:
Logger should be used for logging information within the Multi-channel Commerce Foundation project. It is a thin wrapper around the System.Diagnostics.TraceSource functionality. It maps a TraceLayer value to one of the TraceSource objects that should be configured in the application's configuration file:
Microsoft.Commerce.Trace.Presentation Microsoft.Commerce.Trace.Broker Microsoft.Commerce.Trace.Provider Microsoft.Commerce.Trace.CommerceServer Microsoft.Commerce.Trace.Custom Microsoft.Commerce.Trace.Messages
For example:

member.name: F:Microsoft.Commerce.Common.Logger.PresentationTraceSource
member.summary: Identifies a trace source in the system.diagnostics section of the configuration file used to log traces for the presentation layer components.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Commerce.Common.Logger.BrokerTraceSource
member.summary: Identifies a trace source in the system.diagnostics section of the configuration file used to log traces for the broker layer components.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Commerce.Common.Logger.ProviderTraceSource
member.summary: Identifies a trace source in the system.diagnostics section of the configuration file used to log traces for the provider layer components.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Commerce.Common.Logger.CommerceServerTraceSource
member.summary: Identifies a trace source in the system.diagnostics section of the configuration file used to log traces for the components that call the Commerce Server API directly.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Commerce.Common.Logger.CustomTraceSource
member.summary: Identifies a trace source in the system.diagnostics section of the configuration file used to log traces for the custom components.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Commerce.Common.Logger.MessagesTraceSource
member.summary: Identifies a trace source in the system.diagnostics section of the configuration file used to log all messages except for the traces.
